intro: Strychnos sapinii, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible but have a bitter taste. Its seeds contain toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful if ingested. Strychnos sapinii is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
